Monsanto Company

Farming

10,001+ employees

Share
LinkedIn Twitter Facebook Google+

187,440 followers

Follow
  • Home
  • Careers

We’re more than 20,000 dedicated employees focused on developing solutions to help farmers have better harvests while using resources more efficiently.

We work to help farmers grow crops in a more sustainable way. We think holistically about how food is grown so farmers have the tools they need to have better harvests - so a balanced plate of meats, grains, fruits and vegetables within reach of every family.

Opportunities at Monsanto range from sales and marketing jobs to research and agronomy jobs. We’re always looking for exceptional professionals interested in developing a strong career while collaborating to develop solutions for sustainable agriculture. Sound like a job for you?

View our current opportunities at jobs.monsanto.com

Specialties

Science, Agriculture, Sustainability, Farming, Food, Safety, STEM, Research & Development, Biotechnology

    Great Place to Work® Institute and Fortune® magazine have recognized Monsanto as one of the 50 Best Workplaces for Flexibility, ranking the company No. 11. This is an extraordinary honor and reinforces why our culture is key to the success of our employees and our business! http://goo.gl/is7NI1

    Monsanto Company isn't just the world's largest seed producer. It's an organization working to improve global food security. Team members, by a wide measure, say they're committed to their work and proud to be part of this agricultural company.

  • Monsanto Company
    On March 25th we said happy birthday to Dr. Norman Borlaug, who would have been 102. In 2009, Monsanto established the Beachell-Borlaug International Scholars Program, named to honor Dr. Beachell and Dr. Borlaug, who devoted themselves to solving the problems affecting rice and wheat farmers, particularly in the developing world. Learn more about the program: http://goo.gl/dyQ7k2

  • Monsanto Company
    The safety of our employees, the communities where we operate, our customers and consumers has always been our highest priority. Today we are excited to share that Monsanto and American Red Cross join forces for a First Aid safety app.
    Monsanto is the exclusive sponsor of the Red Cross’ first aid app
    cropprotectionnews.com

    Through a three-year collaboration with Monsanto Company, the American Red Cross will be able to provide lifesaving farm-focused information for people living in rural areas via its First Aid App.
